# California Barber License Requirements (2026)

## Board of Barbering and Cosmetology (BBC)

### Training Requirements
- **Total Hours:** 1,000 hours at a BBC-approved school
- **Curriculum:** Haircutting, shaving, beard/mustache trimming, facial massage, hair and scalp treatments
- **Note:** Hours reduced from 1,500 to 1,000 effective January 1, 2022 (SB 803)

### Eligibility
- Age: 17 years or older
- Education: 10th grade completion or equivalent
- Complete approved barber program OR apprenticeship (3,200 hours)

### Examination
- **Format:** Written exam only (practical exam eliminated January 1, 2022)
- **Questions:** 85 scored questions + 10 pretest questions
- **Time:** 120 minutes
- **Passing Score:** 70%
- **Languages:** English, Korean, Spanish, Vietnamese, Simplified Chinese

### Fees (2025-2026)
| Fee Type | Amount |
|----------|--------|
| Application/Exam | $75 |
| Initial License | $50 |
| Biennial Renewal | $50 |
| Delinquent Renewal | +$25 |

### Key Difference from Cosmetologist
Barbers focus on hair and facial services. They CANNOT perform:
- Chemical treatments (perms, relaxers)
- Nail services
- Esthetician services

### Crossover to Cosmetology
Licensed barbers can obtain a cosmetology license by completing a 200-hour crossover course at an approved school.

### Official URLs
- BBC Main: https://www.barbercosmo.ca.gov
- Barber Requirements: https://www.barbercosmo.ca.gov/applicants/license_requirements.shtml
- School Listings: https://www.barbercosmo.ca.gov/schools/
